Flower symmetry: there is only one way to evenly divide the flower (the flower is bilaterally symmetrical)
Form of lower petal: the labellum has a pouch-like shape
Inflorescence type: the inflorescence has only one flower or a pair of flowers on it
Labellum position: the labellum is in the lower position on the flower
Lower petal characteristics: the labellum is in the shape of a pouch
Lower petal outline: the labellum is simple in form
Nectar spur: there are no nectar spurs on the flower
Orientation of side petals: the lateral petals slant somewhat downward
Self-pollinating flowers: there are no cleistogamous flowers on this plant
Sepals fused only to sepals: the sepals are fused to each other (not other flower parts), at least near their bases
Seed capsule orientation: the capsule points upwards or is angled outwards
Plant green or not: the plant is chlorophyllous (it has green parts)
Roots: the rhizomes do not resemble coral
Underground organs: there are only slender roots on the plant
this plant has a rhizome (a horizontal underground stem with roots growing from it)
Bract relative length: the bract is longer than the associated flower
Features of leaves: the leaf does not have any of the mentioned special features
the leaf is pleated or folded back and forth along its length
Leaf arrangement: basal:  the leaves are growing only at the base of the plant
Leaf blade edges: the edges of the leaf blade have no teeth
Leaf blade shape: the leaf blade is elliptic (widest near the middle and tapering at both ends)
the leaf blade is oblong (rectangular but with rounded ends)
the leaf blade is obovate (egg-shaped, but with the widest point above the middle of the leaf blade)
the leaf blade is ovate (widest below the middle and broadly tapering at both ends)
Leaf blade tip: the tip of the leaf blade is obtuse (bluntly pointed)
Leaves during flowering: there are leaves on the plant when it is flowering
